item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Aeschylus
item.description: "Wisdom comes through suffering. Trouble, with its memories of pain, Drips in our hearts as we try to sleep, So men against their will Learn to practice moderation. Favours come to us from gods." -- Aeschylus

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Colin Powell
item.description: "The freedom to do your best means nothing unless you are willing to do your best." -- Colin Powell

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"I have observed, indeed, generally, that while in protestant countries the defections from the Platonic Christianity of the priests is to Deism, in catholic countries they are to Atheism. [author:Diderot|11004], [author:D'Alembert|3295333], [author:Dâ€™Holbach|1228712], [author:Condorcet|6420223], are known to have been among the most virtuous of men. Their virtue, then, must have had some other foundation than the love of God.
[<i>Letter to Thomas Law, 13 June 1814</i>]" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madelaine add a quote by -Epictetus
item.description:
"Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens. -Epictetus
" -- -Epictetus
